text: _________ The Son of Jesse, of the tribe of Benjamin in Judah, replaced King Saul as king.
explanation:
David, theson of Jesse, from the tribe ofJudah, replaced King Saul as king over Israel. According to the Bible, Saul was rejected by God because of his disobedience, and David was chosen as his successor. David's story is central in the books of 1 Samuel and 2 Samuel.
1 Samuel 16:13 (RSV):"Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brothers; and the Spirit of the Lord came mightily upon David from that day forward. And Samuel rose up and went to Ramah."
David was not only a warrior but also a man after God’s own heart, which made him the rightful successor to Saul.

text: “Ye do err, not knowing the scripture, nor the power of God”. Jesus implies what with this statement?

options.A: Abusing the Pharisees became they are fool
options.B: that we make mistake and do not judge right scriptural thing because we do not know the scripture and what the power of god can do
options.C: he wants in to be filled with the Holy Ghost

explanation:
In the statement,“Ye do err, not knowing the scripture, nor the power of God”(Matthew 22:29), Jesus is addressing themistakesmade by the Sadducees in their understanding of the resurrection. They were questioning Jesus about a hypothetical scenario involving the resurrection and marriage, and Jesus points out that they were wrong because they lacked understanding of both theScripturesand thepower of God.
This statement implies that when peopledon’t know the Scripturesor thepower of God, they may fail to properly understand or interpret spiritual truths. Jesus is calling attention to the fact that a correct understanding of God’s Word and His divine power is important for making accurate spiritual judgments.

text: ............ was the first man who has no record of beginning or end, or any record of his parents or his place of descent.
